title: Update NAMESPACE
body: In addition to this pull request: https://github.com/computationalstylistics/stylo/pull/8 #8

title: Update DESCRIPTION
body: In addition to this pull request: https://github.com/computationalstylistics/stylo/pull/8 #8

title: Update make.ngrams.R
body:
Changed the paste function to stri_paste function from the stringi package (available on CRAN). The stri_paste function is substantially faster than paste function, which is beneficial when making ngrams from large input.texts.
stringi package should be loaded by the stylo package

title: More honest bootstrap consensus tree.
body: If you want a BCT from, say, 10-200 it'll gladly display those values even if in practice it was more like 10-50. It therefore seems to me that mfw.max.original is unwanted here.

title: No more wasting CPU while displaying the GUI.
body: I noticed Stylo was using 100% CPU while displaying the interface, and unless I'm missing something this fixes the problem with no adverse effects.

title: Added tSNE as a viz option
Fixed typo in readme and added reference
body:
Hi Maciej,

This is a test!

Mike

title: replaced corpus literals by variables
body:
Hi Maciej,

I'm doing some computational stylistics during the holidays...

The oppose script didn't use the primary.corpus.dir and secondary.corpus.dir variables.

Also, when using the chi-square zeta, the words_avoided and words_preferred files contain zeta values(?) rather than words. But that's too complicated for me to fix right now. 

I don't read my Huygens mail at the moment, but I do follow pboot@xs4all.nl.

Best,
Peter
